info.title: PdfBroker.io API
info.description: PdfBroker.io is an api for creating pdf files from Xsl-Fo or Html and other useful pdf utilities.

get.summary: Basic method to verify api is up and running

post.summary: Create pdf-file from complete XSL-FO document.

requestBody.description: XSL-FO Request, the basic XSL-FO request. Post your XSL-FO document and digital resources, either as 'multipart/form-data' or 'application/json'

fodocument.description: An entry named fodocument is required in the multipart/form-data request

resources.description: After fodocument is added, add all digital resources one by one to your multipart/form-data request, using the filename as name in the form.

200.description: Returns the newly created pdf file. Either the file directly or serialized as Json if Accept-header is set to application/json

400.description: If any error occurs parsing input

415.description: If content-type of request is not set to multipart/form-data or application/json

post.summary: Create pdf-file from transforming xml document with Xsl-Fo transform document.

requestBody.description: XSL-FO Transform Request. The XSL-FO is transformed on the supplied xml data document. Post your XSL-FO transform document and xml data document aloing with your digital resources, either as 'multipart/form-data' or 'application/json'

fodocument.description: An entry named fodocument with your XSL-FO transform is required in the multipart/form-data request

xmldatadocument.description: An entry named xmldatadocument, on which the XSL-FO transform is applied, is required in the multipart/form-data request

resources.description: After fodocument and xmldatadocument is added, add all digital resources one by one to your multipart/form-data request, using the filename as name in the form.

200.description: Returns the newly created pdf file. Either the file directly or serialized as Json if Accept-header is set to application/json

400.description: If any error occurs parsing input

415.description: If content-type of request is not set to multipart/form-data or application/json

post.summary: Generate an image of to provided pdf file

requestBody.description: PdfToImage Request. Create an image of a page in an existing pdf document.

application/json.example:
{
  "pdfFileBase64String": "<Encode your existing PDF document as Base64 encoded string>",
  "options": {
    "pageNumber": 1,
    "imageFormat": "image/jpeg",
    "horizontalResolution": 96.0,
    "verticalResolution": 96.0,
    "width": 0,
    "height": 0,
    "transparent": false,
    "jpegQuality": 90,
    "pngCompressionLevel": 6
  }
}

pdfdocument.description: An entry named pdfdocument is required in the multipart/form-data request

options.description: After pdfdocument is added, add an entry named options with your PdfToImageOptions object serialized as JSON.

post.summary: Concatenate multiple pdf files into single pdf file..

requestBody.description: PdfConcat Request. Add two or more pdf files and concatenate pages into single pdf document.

pdfdocument1.description: Add pdf files to be concatenated into single file

pdfdocument2.description: You can add more than two files in the same request

200.description: Returns the newly created pdf file. Either the file directly or serialized as Json if Accept-header is set to application/json

400.description: If any error occurs parsing input

415.description: If content-type of request is not set to multipart/form-data or application/json

post.summary: Write text on a page in a pdf document.

requestBody.description: PdfWriteString Request. Write string on page in pdf document

pdfdocument.description: An entry named pdfdocument is required in the multipart/form-data request

options.description: After pdfdocument is added, add an entry named options with your PdfWriteStringOptions object serialized as JSON.

fontfile.description: Optional entry to attach your own TrueType font file to style string

200.description: Returns the newly created pdf file. Either the file directly or serialized as Json if Accept-header is set to application/json

400.description: If any error occurs parsing input

415.description: If content-type of request is not set to multipart/form-data or application/json

post.summary: Generate pdf file from url using the excellent tool wkhtmltopdf.

200.description: Returns the newly created pdf file. Either the file directly or serialized as Json if Accept-header is set to application/json

400.description: If any error occurs executing request

415.description: If content-type of request is not set to application/json

pdfFileBase64String.description: The Base64 encoded string that is the pdf file.

errorMessage.description: If any error occurs the message will be displayed in here

PdfResponseDto.description: When setting the Accept-header in the request to "application/json" the content of the pdf file will be return as Base64 encoded string. Note that converting data to Base64 encoded strings increases the response size with approximately 33%, if you can accept the a binary format it's better to use Accept-header "application/pdf".

imageBase64String.description: The Base64 encoded string that is the image file.

errorMessage.description: If any error occurs the message will be displayed in here

ImageResponseDto.description: When setting the Accept-header in the request to "application/json" the image file will be return as Base64 encoded string. Note that converting data to Base64 encoded strings increases the response size with approximately 33%, if you can accept the a binary format it's better to use Accept-header "image/jpeg", "image/png" or "image/gif".

foDocumentBase64String.description: This is the complete XSL-FO document provided using Base64 encoding.

resources.description: This is a set of key-value pairs of digital resources like images that is referenced in the XSL-FO document. It uses the filename as key and the data is provided as a Base64 encoded string.

FoRequestDto.description: The basic request with the XSL-FO document as a Base64 encoded string with a set of resources provided with a name and the data of the resource as a Base64 encoded string.

xmlDataDocumentBase64String.description: This is xml data document on which the XSL-FO transform document is applied. Provided using Base64 encoding.

foDocumentBase64String.description: This is the complete XSL-FO document provided using Base64 encoding.

resources.description: This is a set of key-value pairs of digital resources like images that is referenced in the XSL-FO document. It uses the filename as key and the data is provided as a Base64 encoded string.

FoTransformRequestDto.description: The XSL-FO transform document and xml data document as a Base64 encoded string with a set of resources provided with a name and the data of the resource as a Base64 encoded string.

pageNumber.description: Which page of the pdf file to generate image from, default is first page

imageFormat.description: Valid options are "image/jpeg", "image/png" or "image/gif". Default is "image/png"

horizontalResolution.description: Set the horizontal resolution, default is 96 dpi;

verticalResolution.description: Set the vertical resolution, default is 96 dpi;

width.description: Set the width of the output image, default value is width of source document. To scale width, and keeping proportions, do not set height;

height.description: Set the height of the output image, default value is width of source document. To scale height, and keeping proportions, do not set width;

transparent.description: Keep the background of the image transparent. This setting is not available in JPEG-files, since transparency is not supported in the JPEG format.

jpegQuality.description: Sets the quality of jpeg images, range 0 to 100, default is 75

pngCompressionLevel.description: Sets the png compression level, range 1 - 9, default is 6

pdfFileBase64String.description: The pdf file to generate image from, as Base64 encoded string.

pdfDocumentsAsBase64String.description: The list of Pdf documents encoded as Base64 strings.

PdfConcatenationRequestDto.description: Request to concatenate a list of Pdf documents to a single Pdf document.

r.description: Get or sets R value of RGB color

g.description: Get or sets G value of RGB color

b.description: Get or sets B value of RGB color

name.description: Gets the name of the font

size.description: Gets the size of the font

style.description: Gets the style of the font

text.description: The text to write in the pdf

pageNumber.description: Get or set which page in the pdf to write on, default is first page.

xPosition.description: Get or set the X axis position on where to write string, in reference to XOrigin.

yPosition.description: Get or set the Y axis position on where to write string, in reference to YOrigin.

xOrigin.description: Get or set the point from where the X axis position should be calculated from. Default value is from left side of page.

yOrigin.description: Get or set the point from where the Y axis position should be calculated from. Default value is from top of page.

PdfWriteStringOptions.description: Options for writing string in pdf page;

pdfFileBase64String.description: The pdf file to add text to, as Base64 encoded string.

fontFileBase64String.description: System fonts are available, but you can provide your own font file to be embedded in the pdf document. Send font as Base64 encoded string.

PdfWriteStringRequestDto.description: The request dto object to write a string on pdf page

url.description: The url to generate pdf from

wkHtmlToPdfArguments.description: Command line arguments passed to wkhtmltopdf.

WkHtmlToPdfRequestDto.description: WkHtmlToPdfRequestDto is the data transfer object for generating a pdf using wkhtmltopdf;

scopes.pdfbroker: Scope to access the PdfBroker API.
